issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: distcp's ignoring failures option should be mutually exclusive with the atomic option

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: distcp should not ignore the ignoreFailures option

comments.body:
Hi [~jira.shegalov], thanks for reporting this.

I'm working on a patch to wrap the {{CopyReadException}} only once. However, I found it's hard to write a unit test which will fail. The current unit tests are not able to detect this bug because the {{map}} method throws an {{CopyReadException}} when calling {{getFileStatus}}, before it calls the {{copyFileWithRetry}}. This makes sense as the file is deleted before the copy operation. This way the unit tests pass with the following condition true (in case of ignoreFailures):
{code}
if (ignoreFailures && exception.getCause() instanceof
            RetriableFileCopyCommand.CopyReadException
{code}

Should we address the orthogonal {{ignoreFailures}} mutually exclusive with the atomic option separately?

Hi [~liuml07], thanks for working on the patch. Regarding the unit test you should consider a full distcp test where you create a file and make it unusable by setting 000 permission. DistCp should be run doAs non-cluster-root user.

bq. Should we address the orthogonal ignoreFailures mutually exclusive with the atomic option separately?
Sure, will you file it?
[~wheat9] even if you had posted your +1, I would have appreciated a chance to review the patch before committing it.

Thanks [~wheat9] for reviewing this patch. I should make it clear that it was not to address the whole issue when I upload the patch. Sorry for the confusion.

As [~jira.shegalov] suggested, I'll update the patch with tests enabled. I filed a new issue [HADOOP-12473] about the atomic option for ignoring failures.

As [~jira.shegalov] suggested, the v1 patch changes unit test helper method {{doTestIgnoreFailures}} by creating a file and making it unusable by setting 000 permission. The unit test {{testIgnoreFailures}} can not pass in {{trunk}} code without this patch, as it should wrap the {{CopyReadException}} only once.

Hi [~liuml07], can you move doTestIgnoreFailures back underneath testDirToFile so it's easier to see what you changed?

Thanks [~jira.shegalov] for your review and comments. The v4 patch moves  the {{doTestIgnoreFailures()}} method back to its old position.

The patch mainly changes helper method {{doTestIgnoreFailures}} by creating a file and making it unusable by setting 000 permission. The unit test {{testIgnoreFailures}} can not pass in trunk code without this patch, as it should wrap the CopyReadException only once.
